olist: Olist is a Brazilian e-commerce platform that connects small and medium businesses to major online marketplaces, handling logistics, payments, and customer service.
olist dataset: The Olist dataset contains anonymized Brazilian e-commerce orders from 2016 to 2018, including information about orders, customers, products, sellers, payments, and reviews.
order: An order represents a purchase made by a customer and can include one or more products.
order item: An individual product line within an order. Each order can contain multiple order items.
revenue: Revenue is the total monetary value generated from completed orders, calculated as the sum of payment values.
payment_value: The amount paid by the customer for an order, including installments.
average order value: Average Order Value (AOV) is the average amount spent per order, calculated as total revenue divided by number of orders.
aov: Average Order Value (AOV) is total revenue divided by the total number of orders.
customer: A customer is a unique buyer identified in the dataset, associated with geographic and behavioral attributes.
seller: A seller is a merchant registered on Olist who sells products through the platform.
product category: A product category groups similar products, such as electronics, furniture, fashion, or beauty.
most sold: Most sold typically refers to the category or product with the highest number of order items.
least sold: Least sold refers to the category or product with the lowest number of order items.
highest revenue: Highest revenue refers to the category, product, or seller generating the maximum total payment value.
lowest revenue: Lowest revenue refers to the category or product generating the minimum total payment value.
quarter: A quarter is a three-month period within a year (Q1â€“Q4).
time trend: A time trend analyzes how metrics such as revenue or orders change over time.
installments: Installments allow customers to split payments across multiple periods, common in Brazilian e-commerce.
review score: A review score reflects customer satisfaction, typically ranging from 1 (worst) to 5 (best).
freight value: Freight value represents the shipping cost paid for delivering the order.
brazil ecommerce: Brazilian e-commerce is characterized by installment payments, large geography, and strong logistics challenges.
dataset coverage: The Olist dataset covers orders placed between 2016 and 2018 only.
duckdb: DuckDB is an in-process analytical SQL database used for fast querying of large datasets.
